accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is unrestricted.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The archivist created this collection from materials that were presumably purchased by the library staff at the University at Albany sometime in the 20th Century.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of Collection
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged chronologically and does not include series.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Sketch
bioghist.p: The library staff of the University at Albany seem to have purchased these materials as a single batch sometime in the 20th Century. Unfortunately, the exact provenance of the collection is unknown.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Michael David Munsey processed this collection in February 2025.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This artificial collection contains materials from late 19th and early 20th Century America and Britain relating to shorthand. Materials include a British shorthand manual; a booklet on laws, rules, and information for shorthand reporters in the state of New York; the by-laws and constitution of the New England Shorthand Reporters' Association; and The Third Book of Phonetic Reading, a guide to English phonetic shorthand reading and writing. The last item is written a phonetic variant of the Latin alphabet. Materials in this collection represent the two primary approaches to shorthand writing: orthographic (an alternative to the traditional Latin alphabet) and phonetic (a phonetic variant of the Latin alphabet).
